inclusion.criterion: primary anesthesia care team has planned for a neuraxial anesthetic
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: patient agrees to receive an adductor canal block
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: subject is < 18 years of age or >80 years of age
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: subject is known or believed to be pregnant
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: symptomatic untreated gastroesophageal reflux or otherwise at risk for perioperative aspiration
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: any condition for which the primary anesthesia care team deems neuraxial anesthesia inappropriate
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: significant pre-existing neuropathy on the operative limb
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has a history of anaplastic astrocytoma and is currently experiencing progressive lower extremity weakness and urinary retention. The patient's primary anesthesia care team has planned for a neuraxial anesthetic, but the patient's condition may pose risks for perioperative aspiration.
